questions.text: The first team to be relegated from the Premier League in the 1992-93 season were Nottingham Forest. Who was their manager during this season?
questions.explanation:
Brian Clough.

	Clough was one of Forest's greatest managers, twice winning the European Cup with them, and was the manager between 1975-93. A 2-1 defeat away to Ipswich Town on 1st May, 1993, was Clough's last game in charge before retiring from the game forever.

questions.text: Leeds United escaped relegation by two points in the 1992-93 season, but what stood out about their statistics than any other team's?
questions.correct: They failed to win a single away game
options: They won all their home games
They drew every game away from home
questions.explanation:
They failed to win a single away game.

	Leeds finished the season with 51 points, having played 42 games, winning 12, drawing 15 and losing 15. Out of a possible 63 points away from home, they earned just 7.

questions.text: Which of the following finished as the highest placed London based team in the 1992-93 season?
questions.explanation:
Queens Park Rangers.

	Q.P.R. finished in 5th place with 63 points. Tottenham were the next London based team in 8th with 59 points, then Arsenal in 10th with 56 points and Chelsea in 11th, also with 56. The other London teams in the 1992-93 Premiership season were Wimbledon who finished in 12th, and Crystal Palace, who were relegated with 49 points.

questions.text: Manchester United won their first championship in 26 years in the 1992-93 season, but which of the following didn't score a League goal all season?
questions.explanation:
They all did.

	Going into the last home game of the season, Gary Pallister was the only outfield player without a goal during the season. United beat Blackburn Rovers 3-1 at Old Trafford with Pallister scoring from an unlikely free kick in the last minute of the game.

questions.text: Alan Shearer made his Premiership debut with Blackburn Rovers in a 3-3 draw at Crystal Palace, but how many goals did he score that day?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Mark Bright had given Palace the lead in the 37th minute until Stuart Ripley levelled the score, five minutes later. Gareth Southgate then gave Palace a 2-1 lead before Shearer showed his worth, notching in the 66th and 81st minutes. Simon Osborn snatched a point in the last minute for Palace.

questions.text: Norwich City were the surprise package of the 1992-93 season, finishing in 3rd place, although they did have one heavy defeat against Blackburn Rovers. What was the score?
questions.explanation:
7-1.

	American striker Roy Wegerle scored twice for Blackburn, as did Alan Shearer. Tim Sherwood, Gordon Cowans and Stuart Ripley got the others for the Lancashire outfit. Rob Newman scored Norwich's only goal of the game at Ewood Park.

questions.text: Manchester United lost just twice at home during the 2002-03 season. One was a 3-0 defeat at Old Trafford to Everton, and one other unlikely team won 1-0. Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
Wimbledon.

	Wimbledon won through a single goal by Lawrie Sanchez in the 79th minute. In all, United lost six times in the League against Wimbledon, Everton, Aston Villa, Arsenal, Ipswich Town, and Liverpool.

questions.text: In the 1992-93 season, Crystal Palace were relegated into the first division, after losing 3-0 away at Arsenal. Which team leapfrogged them to stay at least another year in the Premiership after winning 4-3 at home?
questions.explanation:
Oldham Athletic.

	Oldham beat Southampton 4-3 on the final day of the season to ensure another season in the Premier League. Leeds drew 3-3 with Coventry City, and Middlesborough, already relegated, also had a 3-3 draw with Norwich City.

questions.text: Kevin Campbell and Alan Smith were regular forwards during Arsenal's 1992-93 title campaign, but which of these was another?
questions.explanation:
Ian Wright.

	Ian Wright was signed by Arsenal from Crystal Palace after his dynamic performances alongside Mark Bright. All the others listed never played for Arsenal in their careers.

questions.text: Swindon Town were promoted to the Premier League for the 1993-94 season via the play-offs. West Ham United grabbed an automatic promotion, along with which other team?
questions.explanation:
Newcastle United.

	Newcastle scored an amazing 96 points from 46 games, and finished as Division One champions, losing just 8 times.
